revised_title: The Use of Agaric of Oak in Stopping Haemorrhages: A Case Study
tldr: This article presents two case studies where the agaric of oak was used to stop haemorrhages after amputations. The agaric was applied to the mouths of the principal arteries, effectively stopping the bleeding without causing pain. The author also discusses the possible mechanism of action, which involves contracting the extremities of the divided vessels.
